page.title: 15PRIMARY EDUCN, NEWTON MEARNS
page.content: There are two large Primary Schools in the area both of which use the old closed-plan classroom system where classes are set according to the age of pupils in a year-group. Pupils are taught all the basic ideas of education in primary school e.g. reading, writing and arithmetic with some basic mathematics. In later years they are taught some history and geography and they leave school with a good general knowledge. Pupils start primary school at the age of 5 and leave to go to secondary school at the age of 12. Primary school provides a solid basis for more thorough education in later years.
